quest.name: Stars in the Dark
journal: Hien is, if nothing else, an optimist at heart.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: He's a lot more...straightforward than I expected? And he's certainly not short on confidence.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: But maybe that's the kind of leader Doma needs if they're going to beat these odds. And hey─we've come this far, haven't we? Who's to say we can't go even further?

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Has he truly recovered from his wounds, I wonder? I believe a match may be in order...

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: So─you too have heard of the Naadam.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: "The great battle for supremacy of the Steppe.“ I learned of it during my stay with the Mol.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: To my knowledge no foreigners have ever participated, much less triumphed in a Naadam. But, lack of precedent notwithstanding, I should think we would have good standing to bid them march with us to Doma─should we win.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Will they even permit us to fight, my lord? We belong to no tribe of the Steppe.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: We are not without options, given what Cirina has told me.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: You see, in accordance with the gods' wishes, her people shall participate in the coming Naadam...

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: ...And when they take the field, I mean for us to fight alongside them as fellow warriors of the Mol.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: But we need not discuss this at length here. Come, let us head north to Mol Iloh, where Cirina and her people have made camp for this season.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Cirina came all this way by herself? She's braver than she looks.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: The beasts are never far. I saw more than a few stalking us as we walked. Truly, these lands are fraught with peril.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: My friends, I give you Mol Iloh!

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: The khatun of the tribe, Temulun, resides in the largest yurt. We should go and make our introductions.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: It's smaller and more cozy than Reunion. And is that music I hear? It's strange...but somehow comforting...

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: For all the grand promises my lord Hien has made, it would not do for us to falter now. We must earn the Mol's blessing.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: I am told you have a knack for making excellent first impressions, Forename. Why don't you lead the way?

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: Oh, it's you. Where are your comrades? Did you find Hien?

dialogue.name: TEMULUN
dialogue.text: At last, the traveler comes...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I guess we'll have to beat some strong opponents to win this Naadam...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: But that's good, isn't it? I mean, if they were easy to beat, they wouldn't be worth taking back to Doma, would they?

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: How confident and bold in speech he has grown. More and more he reminds me of his father in his youth...

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Although I have spent much time with the Mol, I have yet to fully grasp the nature of the udgan and their insights.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: That they value the chance encounter, and the potential fortune it brings, however, is plain. Let us try not to disappoint them!

dialogue.name: TEMULUN
dialogue.text: Wheresoever you go, remember that you are not alone. Remember that you carry the fire for them, and they for you.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: ...Thank you all for coming, and for offering to fight with us in the Naadam. Though I still fear our chances grim, I am grateful for your assistance.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: To be recognized as warriors of the Mol, there is a trial you must overcome.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: But before we speak of such things, there is another, more pressing matter!
